Functions for extracting segments of data from edf files

Useful functions for extracting segments of EEG data from edf files

pyEDFieeg.edfSegmentsiEEGSimple.edfExportSegieeg_A(edfs_info, channelsKeep, t_start, t_stop, fs_target)[source]
Parameters

  • edfs_info (dict) –

    a dictionary with the following information: { start_time (list):

    the start time for each edf file (datetime).

    end_time (list):

    the end time for each edf file (datetime).

    record_duration (list):

    the duration for each edf file (timedelta).

    nChan (list):

    the number of channels for each edf file (int).

    fs (list):

    the frequency sampling for all channels within each edf file (float).

    chan_labels (list):

    the labels for all channels within each edf file (str).

    fpath (str):

    the full paths pointing to each edf file.

    }

  • channelsKeep (list) – Unique channels across all edf files; this is the final channel list needed.

  • t_start (datetime) – a list of start times to extract

  • t_stop (datetime) – a list of the corresponding end times associated with the start times

  • fs_target (float) – the minimum frequency sampling found for this collection of edf files.

Returns

the raw data from the corresponding t_start and t_stop lists.

Return type

list

pyEDFieeg.edfSegmentsiEEGSimple.gather_EEGsegment_1efd_A(EDF_path, EDF_chan_labels, EDF_start_time, fs_target, T_start, T_stop, channelsKeep)[source]

This function will gather the eeg signals of the requested channelsKeep list from one specific EDF file. This function works if the start and end times exist in a single EDF file.

Parameters

  • EDF_path (str) – the specified edf file that contains both the start and end of the specified segment requested

  • EDF_chan_labels (list) – the channel labels included in the specified edf file

  • EDF_start_time (datetime) – the start time of the edf file

  • fs_target (float) – the target frequency sampling for all channels

  • T_start (datetime) – the start time requested for the segment

  • T_stop (datetime) – the stop time requested for the segment

  • channelsKeep (list) – the final list of channels to be extracted specified by the user

Return type

EEGsignals (np.ndarray)

The array of the raw data requested. This is channels x time points.
